title: MS Habitual Offender Information (Department of Corrections)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to public records under Mississippi Public Records Act; Miss. Code Ann. 25-61-1 et seq. Specifically, I am seeking information regarding individuals currently sentenced with a habitual offender sentencing enhancement as outlined in Miss. Code Ann. § 99-19-81, 83.. Specifically, I am requesting details on individuals currently incarcerated for habitual offender laws, including their:
- Names
- Date of conviction
- Inmate ID
- Parole eligibility date 
- Specific offenses they were convicted of
Any available demographic information, such as date of birth, age at arrest, current age, race, gender, county of conviction 
If there are any fees associated with obtaining or copying these records that exceed $100, I request a waiver of all fees. I am making this request on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and the release of this information is in the public interest, significantly contributing to a better understanding of habitual offender laws. My request for this information is not for commercial purposes.
I kindly ask for a timely response to this request. If the retrieval of these records will take an extended period, please provide an estimated timeline for when I can expect access to or copies of the requested records.
Should you deny any part of this request, I ask that you specify the exemptions that justify withholding the information and provide details about the available appeal procedures as per the law.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noelle

title: CBP "Gathering SItes" Communications and Policies (San Diego County)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Al Otro Lado, a California 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, requests the below records concerning asylum seekers who await processing by U.S. Customs and Border Protection (“CBP”)  and U.S. Border Patrol (“BP”) at open air processing sites, referred to by CBP and BP as “gathering sites,” in San Diego County:  

1. All communications sent to or received from CBP, BP, and their employees concerning so called migrant “gathering sites” in San Diego. The county may limit its search to communications sent or received between May 11, 2023 and the date that it conducts its search. You should search for emails and text message correspondence with CP and BP employees that contain keywords including but not limited to, “Jacumba”, “gathering site”, “waiting site”, “staging area”,  "migrant camp", "whiskey”, “Spooners Mesa”, “91x”, “O'Neill”, “Moon Valley”, “willows”, and “177.”  The last eight of those keywords are CBP's names for the sites.

2. All policies, memoranda, or procedures concerning any “gathering site.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Al Otro Lado

title: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Ordinance

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Ordinance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past six months (May 2023-November 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses" as described in Sec. 8-4-090 in Chicago's city code.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance
• written notices from the authorized representatives of the city to the owner or controller of the premises identifying nuisances and abatement measures
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
•fines and penalties collected for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
• information regarding any court actions related thereto, including motions for court orders to place a property into receivership or condemnation

From: Heywood, Daralyn (POL)

To: Farrell, Sean (POL); Halpin, Michael (POL)
Subject: Fw: HIU Case #2015-004

Gentlemen,
I respectfully request all recordings, tapes, emails, notes, meeting minutes, roundtable discussions, and transcripts of my HIU Case 2015-004.
Thank You!

Kindly,
Sgt Daralyn Heywood #2449
State Police South Yarmouth
Daralyn

From: Farrell, Sean (POL)
Sent: Wednesday, October 19, 2016 8:37:09 PM (UTC-05:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada)
To: Heywood, Daralyn (POL)
Cc: Halpin, Michael (POL); Lyver, Michael (POL)
Subject: RE: HIU Case #2015-004

Sgt. Heywood: I received your request for additional information and transcripts from the Department relative to the above-referenced investigation. I apologize for the delay in this response.

As you know, the Department, as a courtesy and pursuant to applicable policies, previously provided you, as a complainant, with a copy of the Report in July. The Department, however, is denying your request for additional information.

As an initial matter, this investigation was an internal personnel investigation and, as such, is not subject to public release pursuant to G.L. c. 4, sec. 7, cl. 26 (c).

Second, the investigative exemption G.L. c. 4, §7, cl. 26(f) exempts from public disclosure “investigatory materials necessarily compiled out of the public view by law enforcement or other investigatory officials the disclosure of which materials would probably so prejudice the possibility of effective law enforcement that such disclosure would not be in the public interest.” The investigative exemption serves, in part, to encourage individuals to assist police investigations and provide information. It is also intended to allow investigative officials to provide an assurance of confidentiality to witnesses so that they will speak openly about matters under investigation. Bougas v. Chief of Police, 371 Mass. 59, 62 (1976). The disclosure of witness statements and transcripts by the Department in this instance may only serve to discourage witnesses in future investigations from assisting and disclosing information to this Department.

For these reasons, the Department will not disseminate any additional information.

Respectfully,

Sean W. Farrell, Esq.
Deputy Chief Legal Counsel
Massachusetts State Police
General Headquarters
470 Worcester Road
Framingham, MA 01702
Tel: (508) 820-2153
Fax: (508) 820-2649

communications.subject: (Request # 23-1972) KDHE KORA Confirmation
communications.communication:
This communication is an initial response to your request
under the Kansas Open Records Act (KORA). The Kansas Department of Health and Environment (KDHE) KORA
Officer has received your KORA request.  Your request identifier is provided in
the subject line of this communication. Please refer to that identifier in
any future correspondence pertaining to your request. If KORA applies to your request, your request will be
forwarded for processing.  KDHE may not be able to immediately grant access to
or disclose requested records due to the number of records requests KDHE
receives and because KDHE must review every received request.  If permitted by
Kansas law, KDHE will generally grant access to or disclose the existing public
record(s) to which your request applies within ten business days after the date
of this communication. However, federal and/or state law may limit or prohibit
access to or disclosure of records or otherwise exempt records from public
access or disclosure. KDHE may charge and require advance payment of a fee for
providing access to or disclosing records in order to recoup request
fulfillment costs including, but not limited to, the cost(s) of staff time and
computer services required to fulfill your request.  Pursuant to Executive
Order 18-05, KDHE will not assess any charge or fee for the copying of
documents up to and including one hundred pages when a request is made by a
Kansas resident.  You will receive notice if advance payment is required
or if the cost(s) of fulfilling your request exceed(s) the initially estimated
or requested fee. KDHE kindly requests that you use our online portal for KORA requests. It is located here: https://khap2.kdhe.state.ks.us/KORARequestForm/KORARequestForm.aspx (https://khap2.kdhe.state.ks.us/KORARequestForm/KORARequestForm.aspx) Please contact KDHE using the below information if you have

title: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All publicly releasable records held by your agency concerning the incident that occurred on or around March 16, 2014 at the Varner Unit involving inmate Patric Patterson (ADC #107498) and inmate Michael Black, in which Black allegedly assaulted Patterson, including but not limited to:

— Incident report(s), including investigative notes and narrative descriptions
— Chronological record of events
— Property log(s)
— Memorandums, memos, and notes referencing the incident
— All photos, audio, and surveillance video of or concerning the incident, including but not limited to stationary pod footage, handheld camera footage, and other surveillance materials
— ADC policy prohibiting officers from entering the barracks alone

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Nicole Einbinder.

communications.subject: Re: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson
communications.communication:
I do not handle FOIA requests. I am forwarding your request to Wade Hodge in the Legal Department for response.

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

communications.subject: FW: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson
communications.communication:
Sonny Albarado,

The Arkansas Department of Corrections received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request regarding the incident that occurred on March 16, 2014.  According to Ark. Code Ann § 25-19-105(a)(1)(A), FOIA requests can only be made by citizens of the State of Arkansas.  Although you state that you are a citizen of the state of Arkansas in your request, the address that you provided was for MuckRock News and it is not an Arkansas address.  In order for us to proceed, please provide us with a mailing address as proof that you are a citizen of the state of Arkansas.


Thank you,
LATISHA MEADOWS
Quality Assurance Coordinator
Arkansas Department of Corrections
Phone: 1-501-537-7677
Email: Latisha.Meadows@arkansas.gov<mailto:Latisha.Meadows@arkansas.gov>

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to the The HIDTA/NCRIC, the agency will maintain a log/audit trail of requested, accessed, searched, or disseminated facial comparison analysis information. The information pertaining to facial comparison analysis requests will consist of the following details: Date,Name of Personnel Accessing the Facial Recognition System,Case Number,Requestor Name, Title, Agency, Email, Phone,Facial Comparison System Used,Results (Positive/Negative),Dissemination (Who, What, Where, When, How?),Notes (Enhancements used?)

I am seeking:

1. The current database schema, data dictionary, or other reference document(s) to how the agency keeps track of facial recognition/comparison queries
2. A log/audit trail of all facial recognition or comparison searches run by the agency since 01-01-2018.  The data should contain these and any other relevant fields:
Date,Name of Personnel Accessing the Facial Recognition System,Case Number,Requestor Name, Title, Agency, Email, Phone,Facial Comparison System Used,Results (Positive/Negative),Dissemination (Who, What, Where, When, How?),Notes (Enhancements used?)

As required under the law, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: PBN Incident

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: PBN Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

According to local news reports, Detectives with the Fayetteville Police Department’s Cold Case Sexual Assault Unit made an arrest in September in connection with a 1997 sexual assault cold case. According to the report, using DNA technology not available in 1997 and collaborated with Parabon Nanolabs, Inc., the NC State Crime Laboratory, analysts with the FBI’s Violent Criminal Apprehension Program, and other members of Fayetteville Police Department’s Sexual Assault Cold Case Multidisciplinary Team. I am looking for:

-  Investigative reports, memos,  incident reports regarding this case
-  Any invoices, contracts, or MOUs, with Parabon Nanolabs
-  Any emails to or from representatives at Parabon nano labs.  "*@parabon.com"
-  internal Memos, communications, or presentations referencing "Parabon"
-  communications with the state crime laboratory referencing "parabon" or "snapshot"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Sober Homes

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Sober Homes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following record:


1) I request any and all records regarding Sober Homes available for use by the Barnstable County Sheriff Correctional Facility to include, the addresses, contact information for any and all Sober Homes, Detox Programs, half houses or partial hospitalization programs, and /or any after care programs available, referred by or on behalf of anyone from the Barnstable County Sheriff Correctional facility from 2016 to present to include in state and out of state referrals and contact information.  
2) The employment contract and total compensation, benefits and any "other payments"  to Attorney Amy Kullar, In House Counsel BCSO, Richard COREY Jr, from 2022-2023 and documents naming from which accounts these funds were paid and all approval paperwork for payments.
3) I request the internal and/or public posting for the newly created Barnstable County Sheriff office,  Administrative Deputy Superintendent (ADS) Training position to include any and all qualifications, job descriptions, responsibilities for the ADS of Training.
4) Any email sent from or to Donald Doyles official Barnstable sheriff email to all of the following : "Svetlana Marichal", "Ryan Woods," "Riley Doyle", "Michael Clancy", "Isabel Clancy",  to or from any party with an email address including the "@fgrecoverycenters.com".
5) An email sent by ADS Kevin Fernandes, via his BSCO employee email on 10/4/2023 at 0103 hrs.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daralyn Heywood

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2023-025-00480 Closed
communications.communication:
The Law Department (LAW) has denied your FOIL request FOIL-2023-025-00480 for the following reasons: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2023-025-00480) Our Office does not maintain the requested records in a manner that allows us to search for them.  Accordingly, your request is denied.  You may appeal this determination in writing within thirty days by addressing your appeal to Steven Goulden, Records Appeals Officer, New York City Law Department, 100 Church Street, New York, NY 10007. As a courtesy, however, you are referred to the New York City OpenData website’s posting of ‘Case-Related Information About Civil Litigation,’ accessible at: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/City-Government/Case-Related-Information-About-Civil-Litigation/pjgc-h7uv . This dataset details all publicly commenced civil actions handled by the New York City Law Department from fiscal year 1960 through fiscal year 2022, which are maintained in the Law Department’s case management system as of January 27, 2023. To view on OpenData: follow the link above, then select “View Data” on the webpage. This will bring you to the list of the aforementioned civil actions, where you can customize your view and filters, or choose to export the list to an Excel spreadsheet. To export the list to an Excel spreadsheet, select “Export” from the top right menu, then under the “Download” menu, select the “CSV.” Note that for all postings, all disposition amounts reflect the total for the case and cannot be attributed to a particular defendant, other than the City of New York. 
Please visit FOIL-2023-025-00480 to view additional information and take any necessary action. (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2023-025-00480)

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: W029020-120523
communications.communication:
Mx Hoover: 
 
We have received your request for a public record. It is our goal to respond to these requests as soon as possible or within 5 business days.
